Three small things: no hood (neck was a little exposed), weird pocket placement, and string tie got caught up when I didn't tie it off. Otherwise, I wore this almost every day that I had it, despite the above. I got lots of compliments often; it especially looks great with skinnies or leggings.
A little over the top.

links_reviews_title: Great color, cozy, but fit is odd
links_reviews_text: Wore it for walks in my neighborhood. Love the green color, the length in the back, and the idea of the design. Unfortunately, when zipped and tied it looks like a maternity jacket. Mostly wore it unzipped but buttoned, the ties are long and may drag if not tied. It was really cozy in 20-30 degree winter weather, for that I almost kept it.
Loved this coat, it is fab
I wish I had gotten a smaller size to really have the shape defined. It’s super unique! You have to wear it closed though.
Not right for my hour glass body type. Made my hips look v. wide.
This coat ran wayyyyy large. On the upside, it was absolutely perfect to button over my son in his infant carrier. Overall an interesting jacket—stylish and warm.
Cute but REALLY puffy
Super cute! And warm. Doesn’t make you look super bulky like a marshmallow man but gets the job done!
I ordered a medium but should have sizes down. The tie on the side was fun & cute but a hassle to get on and off. It is also quite a bit longer in the back than the front. Order a size down.
The arms were just way too Small for me. I was sad bc I probably would have purchased this item!

links_reviews_title: My husband said it looked like a trash bag
links_reviews_text: Was so curious about this piece—knew it would be hit or miss. It was a miss for me. Shiny back fabric and the cross-body closure did me no favors. It was light, but warm and covered my butt. Liked wearing it...it just didn’t like me.

links_reviews_title: Super warm, follow numeric sizes for right fit
links_reviews_text: I liked this coat a lot! It's SUPER warm, which was a huge plus for a rental coat in the middle of winter in the northeast. The cut is interesting and I felt really cool wearing this coat. My one complaint is that the fabric is very, very shiny, so it's really like wearing an avant-garde trash bag. It was fun to have for a month but not something I would want to own forever (so, a perfect rental!)

Wore this to San Francisco & Big Bear it kept me so WARM! This is the type of item I don't want to spend money on cause it doesn't get cold enough where I live and then I have a huge puffer jacket sitting in my closet for the majority of the year. Stylish and comfy overall.
The material looks and feels like a trash bag and I just never felt good in it. I liked the cut, but it was too puffy for me. It also held a lot of static and I had fly away hair each time I wore it.

I was convinced I would buy this before I got it. First I should have sized down at least one size. I loved the details like a shawl collar that wrapped when buttoned and the knit cuffs to keep out wind. But the wear is so cumbersome! It has to be buttoned and tied otherwise the ties drag and it looks weird tied back around your back. Took it on a trip and I finally shoved it in my luggage so I didn’t have to deal with it through the airport. But it is a warm and fashion forward puffer. Would have been cuter in a smaller size on me.

Great puffer! Warm enough for 40 degree weather in NYC. Slightly awkward length for a petite person, it’s a few inches too long so putting my hands in the pockets to keep warm felt off (kind of like instead of putting your hands on your hips, you put them 3-4 inches lower). Warning to my super hippy or pear shaped ladies- this will accentuate your lower half, especially when you put things in the pockets (i.e. phone, beanie, tissues). I’m pear shaped and definitely felt more bottom heavy but it’s a fun, different style that I love wearing for a month to mix up my winter coat/jacket game.
Love this style! Very warm and cute. The garment is tight on my hips if I zip it, so I leave it undone. Very cute!

I loved the idea of this jacket! The side tie is so cute and pockets are practical. It runs large and on my 5'4 frame just didn't work. The puffiest part was around my hips making me look like a pear. If you are on the tall, slim side, I think this could work. But it just made me look wide.

I could have sat around the house in this, but with my petite frame, the length and the long strap weren't gonna happen in public. I wasn't really sure how to interpret the sizing but at 5'1" and 130 lbs, 2XS was a bit big. The fabric was awesome, and I would like it in a different cut and size.

I really liked the concept and maybe with a different body shape this would have looked good, but it made me look really bulky. I also couldn’t get past the fabric choice...it looked a bit like plastic. I just couldn’t make it look right on me (and I really wanted to) so I never wore.
The bow on the side made my stomach look huge. The pockets were almost too much on sides as well
This coat is great. Super light yet warm. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was it was a bit shiny for me. Seriously considering keeping it?

I wanted to love this so much! It just doesn’t suit my hourglass figure. It is lumpy and bulky. I’m 5’9, and 154 pounds. It makes me look really wide around the hips and the length and fit are uncomfortable. I’m bummed. I picture myself buying this.

I thought it looked ridiculous the first time I tried it on, but then it grew on me. It’s a little complicated to close (zip + snaps + tie). It’s pretty puffy and warm enough for the cold weather. Nice and light compared to my regular coats.

I really enjoyed this pick, and if it had fit perfectly I would have bought it in a heartbeat as I'm looking for a puffer coat that's stylish but functional. I've worn this in 33-ish-degree mixed-precipitation weather and was plenty warm, though I wonder how it will hold up against true near-zero temperatures. It's very stylish and fashion-forward, although the tie at the side is more of an inconvenience than I was anticipating and doesn't cinch quite as tight as I'd like. The green is a deep, rich green, something I love, and the sleeves were the perfect length for my shorter arms. The shape of it wasn't quite spot-on for my pear-shaped body, but I expected that. Nonetheless, although it wasn't quite as flattering on me as it was on the model, I still loved it enough to wear it more than once. Definitely worth renting just to have people ask where I got it!
Very warm but not too bulky. True to size. Unique. Wish it wld have pockets that zip tho.
Rent this! It’s so cute and well made, I wore it all the time

This jacket was AMAZING! I may order it again, and I almost bought it. Now that I'm thinking about it - why didn't I put it in my new Nuuly box? Gosh. Anyway, I'm 5' 8", 150ish lbs (flex between 140-155) and straight shaped with a big chest, but I got the small instead of a medium. LOVE the rust color, and actually this was surprisingly warm? The arms were a LITTLE tight in the small, which made bell-sleeve sweaters kind of tough to put on under this, but it fit more 'tailored' than I assume the medium would and I'd get the small again. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful coat. The only thing I didn't love were that the snaps were silver, and seemed to stand out a little too much.

links_reviews_title: wish it was zip up instead of snaps
links_reviews_text: The snaps constantly came undone, if you did anything from sit down to bend over. I wish it was zip up or buttons instead of snaps. Not a very warm coat, either.
It is not so bright as pictured. The color is really great. The coat is very good quality, it is warm and cozy. The length is perfect to wear with the dress. Loved it.

Stylish in a great shade in cold days. Yes it’s long as I’m 5’2 but not in a bad way for me because I like keep warm when cold winds are coming through. Loved the pockets and I wish I could afford this coat but overall it was a cozy month.
I was considering buying it; really comfy and cool. Great winter / fall coat!

If you’re hourglass or pear shaped ... this coat is probably not for you. I sized down as advised only to find out it didn’t fit over my hips. Another problem is that the coat closes with cheap-looking snaps. A buzz kill since it’s a wonderfully-colored coat.
Very long like had to wear heels to not look odd and I’m 5’8, but with heels it’s so cute, warm, pockets. Love the color
I just might buy this one, the color so nice, looks exactly as pictured and it is a heavier coat so it will actually keep you warm, very fashionable and versatile

Pretty color and good fit. However the stitching is super cheap and sensitive which is disappointing. The sleeves started to ball up and get fuzzy only after 2-3 wears too! Still considering buying because I like it so much but likely not worth the money.
Loved this coat! Great to throw over anything and be warm and cozy!
I loved this coat. I took it on a business trip East and it was so great. I got lots of compliments on this.

links_reviews_title: I think I’ve found the perfect coat
links_reviews_text: This is a perfect, timeless coat. Perfectly tailored, and the belt makes for a beautiful silhouette. Have worn with everything from dresses and skirts to casual jeans and sneakers. Will be renting again.
This coat was so chic and professional looking. It was very warm. Loved the deep pockets! I'm 5'4" and it ran a bit long on me, but otherwise a comfortable fit.

This coat actually fit me which I was very pleased with since I’m so short. I really liked the color of this jacket and the fit the only reason I didn’t wear it much was because the style of the jacket is very extra. If I had more places to wear this coat I totally would have!
This coat was only okay. Definitely better for taller girls. I am only 5'0 and it was pretty long on me and also felt big in the shoulders.
I loved this coat. It was soft, warm, but not too thick. I am a 38D cup, so I couldn't close the coat because of this. I say if you are a smaller busted person this will fit perfect.
Loved the color of this coat. Long length was perfect for colder days
Great color, length, warmth. Only downside is the very obvious (cheap looking) buttons when the coat is not wrapped closed. I wish they would have used buttons that were the same color as the coat.
I really liked this coat, very classy and great quality - my only wish is that I had noticed its buttons, as it is not my favorite aesthetics, but this a minor thing.

This coat is a great color and fit well but the only thing I did not like were the silver exposed snap front closures. It would look so much better wearing it open if the snaps were gold or the same color as the coat. When the coat is closed though, it looks classy and keeps you warm in 40 degrees
I'm 5'2, and this coat was way too long for me.

I really loved this coat. Warm, cute color, great quality ... however, I wish it would have had real buttons instead of clasp silver buttons. They tend to pop apart pretty easily while walking. Otherwise, super cute and would rent again.
Looks amazing I’m sure I’ll wear it a lot. Only downside is Nuuly doesn’t show the composition and this is 100% polyester. But it looks good enough so I don’t care.

This *technically* fit, but the placement of the pockets and the way it ties is suuper unflattering. I never even wore it. If you have a more narrow figure I could see this looking good, but it just wasn't for me and my curvy body. And the material is kind of stiff/uncomfortable anyway.

I loved this jacket! The color is amazing, it's so soft and pretty warm - not dead of winter with snow warm, but a nice 40 degree day you'll be set! The only downfall of this jacket is that it has a series of snaps for the closure going down the front of it, that when closed you can't see but when open there's a lot. Due to wearing this while 30-34 weeks pregnant I wasn't able to properly close the jacket so the snaps were always showing. Otherwise, this was a hit! I got a lot of compliments and the huge pockets were a nice bonus. Also, at 5'1" this came to right above my ankle length wise.

It is not the warmest coat, as I am in NYC during winter so layer up. It is still worth renting and maybe even buying. I got a small and kind of wished I got a medium. It is perfectly true to size but I like my coats a little larger so I am able to wear a thick sweater under. This is the perfect pull your outfit together coat.
Obsessed with this cute little blazer. Perfect to wear over a sweater for work or over a tiny tank out for some drinks. Loved this so much i ALMOST bought it.
Great pattern with cropped fit, slightly too big
Works well with jeans and a plain top. I never ended up wearing it as it was super staticky and the fringes were sticking to the cardigan.
Love!

Perfect cardigan to wear over almost anything. I styled this with a black long sleeve and black jeans for a solid color look with a pop of yellow. Fringe got kinda annoying somethings and was sorta staticy before a wash

links_reviews_title: Cute and soft, but LOTS of Static
links_reviews_text: So much static! So much so it was pretty challenging to wear.

The off the should was TOO off the shoulder that I couldnt wear it as it would fall down.
It made me happy and optimistic wearing a sweater full of stars.
Very comfy and cute. Fits well.
Fit well. Little sass. Loved this sweater.
The cut on this sweater is great and very flattering. It is not too big or tight. I loved the star pattern. The fabric was not itchy.

Cute, stars aren't too sparkly and sleeves aren't too puffed but nothing special. Material was meh. Very fitted but thick enough that it was fine. Warm, I wore with jeans to kids party, has a young vibe.
this sweater was perfect! i loved it and wore it many times
This sweater was really cute and something out of my comfort zone.
I usually wear a small in this brand, but the sleeves seemed really short... If you are tall or have a long arms, size up.
Close to the body knit - great to pair under blazers, or to dress up or down. A fun, yet refined high quality knit.
I liked the fitted style, and the sleeves weren’t overly puffed out.
Thick, great pockets, perfect for working from home. Liked this sweater.
Such a great find. I loved this so much I bought it. My husband was even excited that I was going to buy it. Highly recommend this piece
love love love, so stinking cute

This sweater is just as pictured. It's a pretty heavy sweater, but is pretty versatile with different temperatures, so I would say this would be a good rental anytime of the year you might want a sweater. The quality is also really great on this knit. Highly recommend!
Loved this one!

I really liked this sweater. I wish I could've found more to wear with it though. I am usually and XS in about everything and ordered a S because of reviews and if I wanted to wear something under it like a fitted long sleeve. I am SO glad I did because the sleeves are super fitted. Really comfortable.
This sweater is so cute and cozy. The arms are a bit tight if you have muscles, but I wore it with tank tops so it was fine. I liked having a hood too for windy days.
Many compliments on this duster since Tim’s pattern stands out. Wore many times and it’s very soft and comfortable
Perfect for a casual outing. Love the way it fits!!
I love this sweater! The sleeves are narrow, but my arms are pretty thin so it’s perfect for me. It’s thick and warm and the perfect length. A new favorite!
Loved it!
This duster is super soft, comfy, and looks great with jeans and a tea. Thinking about buying 😁
This sweater was so cute and cozy! It was long, probably went down to just around the knees which made it extra comfortable. It also has a hood and pockets! I loved this
This is a very cute sweater that is nice and thick but the arms are a bit tight. I can only wear short sleeves underneath. Otherwise it's great!
Loved this top! Great fit, soft material, and not sheer (I was concerned). Light-mid weight perfect for end of winter, early spring. Great sample, easy to style, very versatile.
Love this shirt so much, ended up buying it!
Great piece. Comfortable, good length, cool color.
Loved it and certainly would of lived in it if not for quarantine!

links_reviews_title: Too boxy - runs true to size
links_reviews_text: I ordered a size up, since the reviews indicated it ran left of “just right”- that was a mistake. The large was just too boxy. Didn’t do anything for me.
So soft and so cute
I love this, had a really soft plush inside which makes it extra warm. Classic Breton style top in warm colors.

Arms and stomach are definitely fitted, not a lot of wiggle room, but the next is loose enough that I didn't feel suffocated (and I usually do in turtlenecks). Material is super soft. My trip was canceled (thanks, Coronavirus) and it was already too hot to wear in FL, but I would rent again another time. Tried tucking it in but the tan stripe hit a little unevenly with the pants I was wearing so easier to style untucked.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable enough to be lounge wear!
links_reviews_text: Love this. It is very cute and fits true to size. It is also incredibly soft and cozy.
Favorite simple piece I’ve rented. Love the cut and the quality!
This top is really cozy, the inside is a light fleece/soft lining, but it is not bulky at all. Great for winter, might be too warm for other seasons.

links_reviews_title: I WEAR THIS ALL THE TIME
links_reviews_text: The material is soft. It fits perfectly. And it's a great addition to almost any outfit.
Perfect to dress up or down and the lining was the softest. I bought this just because of how cozy it is (oh and it goes with everything, Winter, spring, summer or fall).
It has a loose fit around the wait but still very flattering and it’s so soft.

I loved this top! Based on the other reviews, I sized up from my usual medium to a large and it fit perfectly. The fleece lining is so soft and warm. The cut is more of a high/low hem than a cropped hem. It fell to my low hip in the front. The beige & tan stripes are very retro. I have long arms and found the sleeves to fit perfectly with the thumb holes. If this top had been a solid color, I would have purchased it!

Loved this sweater- it was such a cute staple item and the thumb holes made it perfect for wearing under a jacket in cold weather. It was a little more cropped than I expected, but still worked great with high-rise jeans, and the material was SO soft!
It fit but wasn’t doing a lot in terms of fun. I thought I’d get a lot of wear out of this but I found it very plain and hard to match. It’s ‘meh’ at best.
This is a nice basic turtleneck. Fabric is comfortable and fit is true to size. It was a little large in the arms for me but overall I liked it.
Loved this top! So cozy and cute, I ended up buying it!

I did not expect to love this so much!! It's so comfy and goes with everything. I usually wear a medium in these kinds of tops, but I have longer arms so I sized up to a large and it fits perfectly! I'm obsessed with the thumb holes in the sleeves. And it's the perfect mock neck/turtleneck height.

The material for this top is pretty thick, but not too warm for a sunny day in Southern California. I’m 32DD and the small was slim fitting but not skin tight by any means. Super comfortable and easy to style for work or weekend.
Love love love. So flattering go with so much and feels like your wearing a fleece blanket. Really cozy!!!
Looks solid with denim. Great turtleneck for winter.
Great fit.
I liked this top. Good quality fabric. The crop is not too short.
I LOVE this top. It’s so soft and matches so many things. The fit is perfect and there are THUMB HOLES!!

links_reviews_title: Warmer than expected - simple and cute!

Overall a much higher quality turtleneck than some thinner turtlenecks I've worn in the past - perfect thickness between a sweater and a long-sleeve tee. Runs TTS and was the perfect length to tuck into jeans. Highly recommend!

This was the perfect amount of tightness for me. It was very flattering and SO SOFT. Might end up buying it. The sleeves were supposed to be long enough to have the thumb holes you can use but they hit me at the wrist.
Had a lot of potential but very thin material. Still cute. Not the best of fits.

I love this coat! It’s so soft and cool. The lining is plaid and amazing! I would have bought it but we are in quarantine and going into summer time. I wore it around the house in sweats when I was cold but would have looked so cute with jeans! This is a cool spin on a teddy coat. I will def rent it again!!
Runs really big, like two sizes too big

links_reviews_title: So cosy and really stands out

I am 5'2" and the XS of this jacket hit me at my lower shins. I never ended up wearing it because it looked a bit ridiculous being that oversized and long #Hagridvibes

I can wear a small or medium in coats, depending on the cut. I ordered the medium only because that’s what was left and I wanted to wear it so badly, but I would definitely order the small next time.
Great coat, a little itchy, but still wore it!
A small was perfect for me. This was such a comfy coat and I felt like a million bucks wearing it! It's so soft and everyone wanted to hug me while wearing it ;)

super big lapels make me feel like a 70s disco queen! thick, i love it so much! true to size!

So many compliments! I was so warm and felt cute everywhere I went!! Hard to send back!

I love the look of this coat on the website but when it came in person, I felt like I was drowning in it and there is no lining. The inside of the coat looks/feels like the underside of carpet. This coat would be SO much better if it had some lining.
Loved this coat. Very warm, but not great when it's super cold due to opening at chest
Love this jacket... very soft and warm but slightly itchy on the inside. Cute for a night out in the winter

links_reviews_title: So chic! But not very warm

Got this for a wedding weekend in Chicago and it was VERY warm! It is oversized so size down as much as you are comfortable with and it will still look big. Definitely recommend though! It grew on me the more I wore it!

I loved this coat! So warm for the winter, pockets to hold your wallet AND I got stopped on the street multiple times so that people could tell me they loved my jacket!

links_reviews_title: Bold statement piece for a formal event!
links_reviews_text: I never in a million years would ever buy a piece like this. However, Nuuly empowers me to be bold and try new things that I normally might not gravitate towards. This piece was a showstopper! I wore it with a black flowy gown and it was so fun! One thing that I didn’t discover until the end of the night though: IT HAS ARM HOLES! So you can wear it more like a lil coat or cardigan which was amazing! I felt like such a glam diva and that was really fun for an evening.

I wasn't sure how I was going to like this when it arrived in my box. It's definitely a cropped look but I ended up actually really enjoying wearing it. It wasn't always the most comfortable turtleneck but otherwise, it was a win.

Also received a lot of compliments! However, it definitely does run a little small. I'm usually an xs but based on the reviews decided to size up to a small, and I'm glad I did, since it is cropped. Overall highly recommend!

links_reviews_text: I wore with white wide-leg pants, skinny jeans, and sneakers. So lovely!

This is by far my favorite item that I have received from Nuuly since I have had my subscription. It fits perfectly, it is comfortable, and it's unique. I got so many compliments when wearing this sweater. I probably wore it at least 10 times, maybe more!
This is a gorgeous, comfy sweater that literally a dozen people Yucomplimented me on the first time I wore it. Loved the style so much I scoured the internet for other items bythe same designer.
cute basic shirt, liked it
Very cool. Lots of compliments. Runs tight in the arms.
This is thin and a touch small - fits more like a cozy shirt than a sweater - but it's sooooo pretty. I loved the colors and the print, really felt like an outfit all in itself.
Bright and fun sweater.

Such an expensive sweater and I can see why. Perfect weight for sf winter. I never sweat and it was a great layer on Cooley days. It was funky enough to be the main event of an outfit or blend in under a cardigan. Loved it!
Really well made and got a ton of compliments
This was a cute design, but for how expensive it was I was surprised that it was quite thin and kind of itchy

Love this sweater. I've been eyeing it on the Stoned Immaculate site and was stoked to see it on nuuly. I ordered in XS, which is the size I typically wear, it fit everywhere but the sleeves were pretty tight. (by pretty tight, I mean very tight). I was actually okay with it, but some people may find it uncomfortable.
i love this thing!
It was cute. Boho/hippie vibe. It did run a little tight, but I still liked it.
I liked this and wore it a few times, but it wasn't as appealing in person as in the picture, in my opinion! Also not the most comfortable
Loved the colors! True to the photo. Like other reviews, runs small with not much stretch.
I wore this with black jeans a black shaggy cardigan. There is no black in the sweater so I felt like a ray of sunshine

I got many compliments on this one. I usually am a small for tops, though I wish I would have gotten the medium for the extra room in the shoulders and arms. It still fit enough to wear, but it would have been nicer one size up.

links_reviews_title: Lots of compliments but personally was meh about it
links_reviews_text: So this was a piece that kept popping up on my social media ads b.c. it is UP MY ALLEY. I had to try it on Nuuly because tbh its really expensive for what it is. And I guess because of the price I was expecting a goddam miracle so to me it was sorta just meh. I felt like the sweater itself was fine quality and fit too loose around the waist area (you can sorta see the bagginess in the pic of the model). If I left it untucked it was almost sloppy. I tucked it and wore my highest jeans to tighten it and give me more of a figure. I have to give it 4 stars because i got a lot of compliments on it from strangers and friends. The colors are fun and I would totally buy it for half the price and only if it were tighter.
I got so many compliments on this sweater--it is def a snug fit, but true to size. It will add such a fun pop of color to whatever you are wearing, I wore this several times and loved it!
The fit was good— a little tight in the arms, but not uncomfortable. Accentuates bust. I got a lot of compliments from men and women. Loved it with the gold Jeni bomber jacket.

I am in love with a sweater! Soft and lightweight with the most beautiful pattern. I came super close to purchasing. This does run small as I am normally a size small but the size medium fit me perfectly.

links_reviews_title: A little snug but still amazing
links_reviews_text: I love this sweater and still can’t decide if I’m going to keep it. It definitely runs a little small, but it is suppose to be a snug fit. The colors are amazing. Really high quality. Such a great sweater.
Soft, lovely fabric. More colorful than anything I own but it still felt easy to wear. I styled this with high waisted, slightly flared jeans and rustic booties to stick with a 70's theme

Every time I wore this sweater (which was often!) I got compliments. Such a fun, playful, laid back design that looked effortlessly casual and elevated. A touch short in the waist for us taller gals-I had to wear with high waisted jeans. Otherwise tts.

This was the absolute best sweater EVER. I got so many compliments on this sweater, especially from dudes? Bright, cheery and colorful during the dreary winter months. Even though it's a bit of a splurge I really want to buy! Definitely a "one of a kind" piece. Picture shown is an entire nuuly outfit...cords, sweater and teddy. Got lots of compliments on this one. :)

I sized up to a medium and it was still very form fitting. This sweater is soooooo amazing. It's the perfect combo of high-end and vintage vibes. Looked great with high waisted flares. Wish I could have kept it!
LOVE LOVE LOVE this sweater. I wish I could afford to buy it. RENT IT
Soft and comfy, felt cute wearing this. Paired it with the giant bell bottom jeans also from Stoned Immaculate available on Nuuly. Highly recommend!
I never wore this because I got the wrong size, but I wish I could have because the quality was great, the colors we're perfect and vibrant with a great 70s feel.

links_reviews_title: Wore this almost every day during quarantine
links_reviews_text: I rented this sweater because I needed some color and some fun during this dreary time. It's a lovely cashmere, the neck is a bit itchy because it's ribbed, but I wore a Tneck and didn't zip it all the up anyway. All I've been wearing are black yoga pants and that's how I've been wearing this sweater. I really have worn it almost every day!

I really liked those sweater! It’s really light material so I wore it in the house a lot since I can’t really go anywhere right now. I just love how different and bright it is. Definitely recommend if you want something kind of weird and fun.
Fit great. Wore with jeans and black slacks.
This is a great sweater, loved it a lot, very comfortable, good sizing, great bright colors. I only didn't keep because it was slightly out of my price range!
Weather was too warm to wear.
This sweater is hip, well made and comfortable. It definitely stands out in a crowd but isn’t too flashy!
Love this sweater! I wore it from work into evening, with a tank underneath, and got a ton of compliments. It’s soft and comfortable. It’s definitely a winner!
wasn't as impressive from the front (the back is cool since there's no zipper to interrupt the pattern). the cut wasn't particularly flattering.
I would give this 6 stars if I could. My favorite item so far on Nuuly. Sadly, even the sale price is too expensive. Big bummer.

How can you get better than that?? Loved running errands in this sweater around LA. Got lots of compliments and it fit perfectly. It was so comfy and if it was't so expensive in the first place I'd buy it!!

I loved the idea of the sweater. It photographs well and looks good on film - however I was not super impressed with it IRL. It's nice but I think I was expecting it to be a bit more lux. However - if you are wearing it for photos/film you'll look like a star!
Love the colors and the modern pattern. Zip makes it versatile. Super soft!
Super cute zip-up. Definitely a statement maker. It fit well and was not itchy, and I loved the sporty look of it!
This sweater was perfect to rent for dinner with the girls. The cashmere is cozy and warm, and the colorful stars are so fun!

This added some brightness to my weekends. The cashmere is very soft and the sweater is a lot of fun for casual weekends. It's a bit too memorable to wear non-stop, but a great rental piece. It is a bit snug so if you like things baggier I'd size up.
I would love to wear this, but just could not bring myself to wear so many stars. The sweater is somewhat static and for that reason somewhat uncomfortable. The fit is amazing though!
This hit the top of my mid-high waisted jeans. Didn't really show any skin, maybe the tiniest gap. Very cozy and bright. Got a lot of compliments.

Nothing beats cashmere for northern California weather, and this brought a light to my grey stay-at-home days! It wasn't quite as cropped on me as it was on the model, which I liked. I styled it with black high waisted jeans and definitely thought about keeping it.
Super comfortable and soft, with vibrant colors. Fits well and is flattering.
Looking at purchasing Favorite colors and a great fit. Shows that you get what you pay for!
LOVED! Super soft and brightened up my day each time I wore it. Would totally recommend and likely to rent again in the future.

I loved this so much, I'll be renting it again in my next box. The cashmere is so soft and the colors are so fun! I like that it's slightly cropped too. I'm 5'7 and it fell just below the belly button.
This is SUCH a fun sweater. I got so many compliments on it! Wishing it wasn’t so expensive, otherwise I would totally buy this one.
This sweater is fun, light yet warm, and very flattering. I knew it was a crop, so I got it with the intention of wearing outside of work. Love how comfortable it is!

links_reviews_title: Run, don't walk! Neon cashmere perfection
links_reviews_text: The photo doesn't do it justice. So soft, so decadent, so neon. Wear it with jeans, wear it with pajamas, doesn't matter, just wear it. It's one of the most luxurious things I've ever rented from Nuuly.
Great and fun sweater to wear! Wish I had kept it
It’s obviously very short which I liked with my black high waste workout pants. It’s wide at the bottom so not super flattering for broad shoulders but it’s fun to wear once in a while.

I would love to buy this but too pricey for my budget!! Definitely keeps you super warm. Other than that, not itchy, comfortable, super vibrant colors. I wore it to a show and was kind of overheating but got a lot of compliments. Would be best for the really cold months.
Really liked this, looked great with high waisted jeans. Wore it to work a few times!

Obsessed with this sweater and would absolutely buy if we weren't heading into warmer weather in Texas. I wore this one multiple times and got so many compliments. Heads up, though, that it is pretty cropped and I was not able to wear to work (even with high wasted jeans), but super cute for the weekends with a pair of jeans and sneakers!
Was soft and not itchy, very cropped length. Wore my highest waisted jeans and still could barely wear it to work.
This is very different than my style, but I love the neon colors and the cashmere was so soft and lovely. It felt slightly more cropped than it looks on the model.
People stopped me on the street to tel me how much they loved it. Almost kept it, but didn’t. Pic is with a turtleneck under

links_reviews_title: Cute sweater! Not as soft, and short.
links_reviews_text: I was expecting this to be a little softer given that it has cashmere, but it fit and was fun to try. Only worked for me with ultra high rise denim. Looks best with a light wash as it is pictured. Wouldn’t buy or rent again but wasn’t bad.
This pullover fit great (size up because cashmere). It is so soft and well made but it was a lot brighter in person than in the pic.
Super cute sweater! Fit perfectly! I wore with high waisted black jeans and metallic boots and received so many compliments. 100% cashmere!

Love this pullover! Super cute and soft. The bright colors are awesome and true to the online pics in person. I was surprised that it's an over $300 piece until I realized that it was cashmere (!!). Fit nicely and felt comfortable. Hope to see more of this bold/high-contrast style on Nuuly. <3
This is the dopest pullover EVER. I literally got a ton of compliments in it and it’s so soft and nice. Maybe after tax shmoney I’ll come back and buy this stunning thing.
The snaps and yellow detail are so fun. Runs a little small - definitely pretty cropped on me but it was still cute. I took off one star because it was itchy and the fabric felt a little used.
I cannot even tell you how many compliments I received on this sweater. It's incredibly cute and looks expensive. Super comfortable. I will absolutely be renting again.

This is such a cute light weight sweater, perfect for Spring in NJ. I read the previous reviews and went with the size M. The sleeves are fabulous and the sizing worked except it runs very short. I wore it once but felt very self conscious that it kept riding up.

I am usually a M in tops and sized up based on the reviews. I am glad I did because it is more cropped than the photos on the model show. in the L the length was perfect with high waisted jeans and I loved the pop of color and sleeve button detail. The sweater is so soft and the material is thin which makes it great for spring weather.

I lean towards things that are a little unique, which this was and I loved it. I wore a few times, mostly paired with some really big bell jeans I have and some sneakers, I got a lot of compliments form everyone except my teenage daughters:)
Lighter material than I thought which is better because the arms are light. Soft and comfortable, easy to wear.
Cute sweater but way too small. I ordered a large and it was small everywhere. Not sure if someone washed and shrunk it but way too small to wear.
Great sweater, so stylish even my husband noticed it!

I loved this sweater shirt. I got a lot of compliments when I wore it. It fit almost perfectly. The sleeves were a little too long but not so long that I couldn't wear it. I wore it to work and dinner with friends.

Alas the stripes and snap buttons are so cool (can unbutton all the way up) but it was borderline itchy and definitely cropped, tried with a cardigan underneath for work and looked weird. I don’t own high waist work pants which this requires. Also as someone who hates turtlenecks thought this looked not too tight at the neck but it didn’t work out.

I am usually between a small and a medium and picked a medium on this one and was really happy with it. It's a very well made sweater and looks cute with high waisted jeans and sneakers. Loved it, but is definitely memorable so would be hard to wear often without people noticing.

links_reviews_title: A little short but very stylish
links_reviews_text: I loved this sweater! The neckline and the pop of color and buttons were really eye-catching without being too much. It was a bit short on me, so next time I would get an S (I'm usually between an XS and an S). It's SUPER soft and very comfortable.
N/A
These jeans are such a cute staple. I loved them, they are perfectly flattering and vintage feeling. I am usually a size 25 or 26, but the 26 was tight on me.
These jeans fit amazing -- cinched at my waist no dreaded back gap but also comfortable around my thighs. Comphy but make your bum look great -- highly highly recommend
These jeans are my absolute favorite pair. I loved them so much I kept them. Very high wasted and the perfect length for me (I’m 5 feet tall but longer legs than torso).

They're great quality, flattering, and hug in all the right spots. You can dress them down or up - I personally wore them with casual tees and sneakers. The best part of these pants: last month I was in Vegas with my two best friends to see a Shania Twain concert. I was wearing these beauties while day drinking and walked up to a bar to order a drink when this beautiful 40-something-year-old woman tells me how much she loves my pants. We get to talking and next thing you know, she's inviting me and my 2 best friends to sit at her VIP bottle-service-table at the Shania Twain concert that she had reserved for that night (our tickets were for nose bleed seats). It was one of the best nights of my entire life and it's all because of the conversation that was started because of these pants.
Love these jeans so much I purchased them! Love the super high rise and hugs your bottom in all the right places.
Absolutely love the style except it was a tight squeeze getting into these. No budge at all. Definitely go up a size if you plan on renting.

These are fantastic jeans. Really great high rise, and they didn't stretch out. Very comfortable, even great for just wearing around the house when you want to feel a little more put together during a quarantine. If I would have rented these a few months ago, I would have bought them, but it's too hot to wear jeans very much in the summer where I live. I'll definitely consider renting again and buying in the fall. (If we can go outside then...)

Loved this and wore them all the time. The 24 fit me but it was a taaaaaaaad tight. Should have probably done the 25 because there is very little stretch. These are so flattering and fun to style. Lots of compliments, will rent again when they're back in stock!
I’m between sizes and read the reviews so I sized up. Great decision. They’re perfect every day with crop or baggy tee pants, but also can pair with nicer top. Just great overall. 👍🏼
Loved these so much that I bought them! Fit true to size, and were so flattering in the waist and pockets.

I wanted to wear these so badly! I didn't realize how tightly they would fit, or I would have sized up. I wear a 26 in all of my jeans - so I was shocked that these didn't fit. Super bummed. I have athletic legs, and these did not come close to getting past my thighs.
I absolutely love these pants, I got so many compliments about them. I was able to dress them up and dress them down.
These are my absolute fave- I'm buying for sure! I have wide hips and a tiny waist so usually jeans are big around the waist for me but these were perfect. They are so cute with a crop top.
I got the wrong size but still almost wore them out. They are super cute

when i first tried them on they were super tight (had to lay down to button them up) but oh my god did they look beautiful. the denim is so high quality and for someone with a teeeny waist and a huge butt it actually fit me correctly :,) now after wearing it a few times they fit great, & i wore them so much i just had to buy. absolutely obsessed. you have to try them!

These pants were a little bulkier than jeans for my liking, but ended up wearing them to work once. Super high wasted and flattering because of that. I work with a black tee tucked in and got lots of compliments
Really wanted to love these. I felt like a pencil, and not in the good way? Fabric was thick and sturdy, but ultimately they were too long and not that flattering of a shape on me.
Great fit, cool wash, and true to size! Love them, might keep em.

I LOVED these jeans! I wish I bought them :( They were so cute and just went well with everything. They're super high waisted - which I love! They were like an ankle length on my (I'm 5'8) but luckily that's in right now!
as with the vast majority of jeans, these fit well through the hip and thigh, but were very very loose around the waist.
These jeans are supposed to be ankle length, but on a 5'2 girl, they are the perfect full length

Cute, comfy vintage-style jeans that are also very flattering (my butt has never looked better!). After having rented several pairs of Levi's through nuuly, I've learned that the 25s fit better than the 24s (which is my usual denim size). I paired these with the Ro & De Kiernan High-Neck Blouse as well as the Lost + Wander Frontier Faux-Fur Jacket (pictured).
Loved these pants but they were too tight in the wrong places
Super confortable and versatile jeans. I could wear them with anything and dress them up or down. Big fan!
These are really cute, super rigid, and very high rise. They do have a bit of a flare though that I felt wasn’t easy to tell from the photos. Definitely pairs best with a tight top for that reason!
Loooveeeeee these!

The fit on these was almost perfect but felt a little tight in the thighs and a little too big in the back waist area. These are really cute pants and fit me at a perfect length because I'm so short. The details don't seem as loud as the online pictures and I felt these were more like a neutral pants because of the muted colors.
These would have been cute but they were way too tight around the waist and hips. In my normal size, I could button but I couldn’t breathe.
I loved these pants and ended up buying them. I'm 54 so they were longer on me than the model in the picture but I didn't mind.

These were super functional and good quality denim. They didn’t do a ton for my butt but I really liked the several buttons down the front. These actually fit my wide hips + small waist really well which impressed me. I also liked them best cuffed (expected since I’m short) and found they held their cuff really well. Considered buying.

links_reviews_title: This is THE fit and print
links_reviews_text: The fit of a Levi’s ribcage is heaven and the print goes with everything...after all cheetah is a neutral. True to size and comfy from the corduroy fabric.

These are awesome. They are so in style right now and so comfortable. I will say that I sized up based on reviews because I can usually go either way but glad I sized up they fit snug but in a good way! buying!

links_reviews_title: Fun, cute, but just a little small
links_reviews_text: I'm normally between a 27 and 28. Ordered a 28 and technically fits but I think the 29 would have been perfect!

links_reviews_title: Great - if you don't have a larger bottom half
links_reviews_text: I was super excited to try these jeans on... but I am just not a Levi's body. These jeans are not made for ladies with hips. I also got these in 2 sizes bigger than my normal jeans (I normally wear 28 in Everlane) and had to squeeeeze to button these closed. The denim itself was nice - I was just sad they didn't fit my curvy lower half.
These fit perfectly! Absolutely love the high waist, the flare, just love. Also I didn’t realize how many things I could wear with cheetah print! My new go to 💕

links_reviews_title: Meh- didn’t feel great in these
links_reviews_text: The quality was great. Was hoping to be more excited about these but the cut didn’t fit my frame so well. Wish they were more cropped on me, if available I would have gotten a petite size. Wish my normal 26 size was also available.

links_reviews_title: said I wasn't going to buy anything, here we are
links_reviews_text: I wore these pants with either a black sweater or a black body suit multiple times a week. They are comfortable and soft and fit my wide hips without gapping in the back!!!

I loved these pants! I ordered my normal size 26- and was able to wear them but they were definitely tight in the waist and in the buttons (no zipper). I may order a size up next time for more comfort!

Surprised this actually buttoned up. I’ve got a bit of a pouch going postpartum so that was good but overall felt like the style didn’t look that great on my short curvier body. Pant went all the way down to feet so didn’t have the same cropped look.

I really enjoyed wearing these. I'm typically a size 4 (Lucky) or 6 (American Eagle) in jeans, so I snagged a 28 - I've heard Levi's run a little small, and these ones def were snug. I loved the rise, but due to my height (5'9) they just weren't quite the right length on me. These hit somewhere between a capri and an ankle jean, which just wasn't quite right. I had fun with them while I had them, though!
Too cropped and not flattering on me.

I usually don’t go for this kind of Jean style, so I thought renting them would be perfect! I ended up loving them so much, and wearing them so many times, that I had to keep them! High waisted, so flattering on my booty, would definitely recommend!

These pants are the perfect pop of funk for a fun day out! I wore this out to party's, I wore these to work, and I wore them just around town! The fit is so amazing and has just the right amount of stretch so they are super comfortable for a whole day in them if needed!! I usually paired them with a black or white cami, and then a black jean jacket on top. One time I paired them with an olive green turtle neck, plus some black booties and big hoops. Seriously my favorite pair of pants!
These jeans became my go-to's (I ended up buying them.) They are an epic fit & added flare to any outfit I wore. Definitely size up! I'm usually a size 29 but went for a 30 and they fit perfectly.
These on-trend jeans will make your booty look amazing!! The wash of the jeans is the perfect medium blue. Also loved how high rise they were. Get these.
Great for tall gals because they aren't too short and the waist hits at a really good spot. They are great for colder nights out because of the corduroy fabric too!

maybe they would look better on someone who is super tall and skinny. but just not the most flattering for my 5''3 frame. they were definitely not an ankle crop for me and i had to do some serious maneuvering to achieve the cropped look. i wish they were available in short because they would probably be super cute!
These were way more flared than I anticipated. Ordered my usual size, but was still way too tight.

OK, so... These aren't jeans. They're corduroys. I loved them nonetheless, but really needed to state that for others so you're not confused like I was when they arrived. I wore these a ton and got lots of compliments. The 25s fit perfectly. The only issue that I have with them is the button fly; it gave me a bit of a "pooch-y" look.
But I ordered them a size too big :( would have loved them in my right size

I'm usually a 25 in Levis, and while I know their is some size variation in their denim styles, I'm very glad I sized up. When I got the 26 I had to do some shimmying and a big suck in to get them on the first time. There is 1% elastin so they keep their shape and don't stretch out, but they did give a little, making them perfect after a few wears. Got lots of compliments, definitely purchasing.
loved wearing these pants. the quality felt great! i am pretty tall, and i thought the crop was just a smidge too short. was cute w long boots and/or with sandals probably in warmer weather.
Perfect! Run true to size, flattering and very comfortable.

Loved these and wore a ton -- considering purchase! These were SUPER high rise... longer on me than the model (ankle grazing) but i did a cute cuff to make them a little more cropped. Also seemed a bit wider leg than the model photo but they're so high and tight they looked great!

Maybe I'm too old to wear this kind of jean. I love it in the pictures, I love it when I see people on the street, but when I put them on, they reminded me of the Saturday Night Live mom jean skit. Where did we go wrong here? Well, first I'm pretty short, so I think these jeans would look really nice on a taller woman. Still, there were quite a few petite woman in the reviews raving about these. The second thing: although I'm small, I'm kind of curvy. I think this shape would better flatter somebody with a more straight figure and not such a big waist/hip ratio. I think it was the combination of short and hippy that made these not work for me. Otherwise, I liked the wash, and I think somebody else could really rock these.

I love the idea of this style, but the pants fit way different than the model in the picture. They were completely floor length and not fitted at all. The waist fit but that was about it, every other aspect was totally baggy :( If it had been a little more snug it would have been a great pair of mom jeans.

I'm 5'6 and these ran super long on me. In the picture they fit the model like cropped jeans, but on me they were normal length jeans. They ended up fitting like mom pants, and they were okay but they weren't totally what I was expecting them to be, which was disappointing.

links_reviews_title: Cute jeans, but a little too long
links_reviews_text: I love the style and they fit perfectly in the waist. They were a little too long for me though. I don't have very long legs and folding them looked silly because of the wide leg.

Rise is high as advertised, but that's what I wanted. They really felt liked they sucked me in from the hips up, which I love. Leg is straight, even a little wide. The wash is a true blue - very 90s. Loved these, almost bought them, but will definitely rent again. They were basically full length on me, but I'm 5'1".

These are really cute and I love the high rise, but I was worried they'd be too tight. These jeans do have a bit of stretch, so I really didn't need to size up. They ended up baggy in the wrong places, unfortunately.
Very cute high-waisted pants
I read the reviews and sized up it was perfect. I love them so much I bought them. They are so comfortable and fashionable. Received so many compliments

I was expecting these to be too long for me. I'm 5'1, 110 pounds and normally, flare jeans, in particular, run too large. While they do hit just slightly below my ankle (where they probably weren't made to hit) they still look fabulous. These jeans are incredible but do not have much stretch whatsoever. I have gotten other pants from Nuuly made of jeans or corduroy that I now know must've had a bit of stretch or give to them so keep this in mind if you aren't sure of your exact measurements. I put them on first out of the bag and immediately purchased them. These will be a staple!
These are a total must have! I won’t them probably 7 times this month
One of my all time favorite pieces I’ve rented!!
These are great but just order a size up!

I usually wear a size 28 but there was only a 27 so I kind of knew they would fit small. The leg fit so well and the length was perfect. I'm not one to wear lots of print but this was my wild card pick and I still wore it a lot! Totally recommend.
Can't say anything bad about these pants. I got a lot of compliments on them.

Love these except I ordered too small. Order at least 2 sizes up to fit. Paired with a black turtleneck, sexy pumps, and a fierce coat I wore this look out to dinner and a show and got too many compliments to count.

I couldn't stop wearing these. Th high waist, and cropped length were perfect on my petite frame. I typically wear a 6petite, and these worked in a 29. I have curvy hips, so it's rare to find things that also fit in my waist. These are right on. I loved that the corduroy was a little flexible, and not as stiff as denim.

links_reviews_title: Super fun to wear! I'm trying not to buy them....
links_reviews_text: I'm not supposed to be buying everything Nuuly sends me lol!! These are great and flattering and comfortable. I still have a handful of days to decide.... I'll bet I talk myself into keeping them....
Really liked these pants. More corduroy than they appeared, but very cute fit. Wore a few times w a black chunky sweater.
I was so excited about these jeans, but when they arrived I found out that they are corduroy. Between that and the tight fit, I didn't wear them. I recommend sizing up!
Love these, but I would suggest ordering a size up. They were pretty tight in the waist.
I absolutely died for these funky leopard cords! Got so many compliments and couldn’t stop wearing them! Highly recommend! ✨

links_reviews_title: High waisted denim of your dreams!
links_reviews_text: Loved these denim/cord leopard pants. I have a straight figure and the size 27 fit perfectly! Loved the fit and way I felt wearing these high waisted straight leg jeans. Tons of compliments and they’re so versatile! Dressed them up and down and wasn’t afraid to rewear often.

I loved these so much, they’re my first piece I’ve actually committed to owning! Other reviews have said they run small, but I don’t agree. They have such a high waist that looks tiny but the cord has so much give to it. I went with my normal Levi size and am thrilled! They’re full length on me though at 5’6.
These were really cute, comfortable, and warm! My thighs tend to rub when I walk, but it didn't make that typical corduroy noise, which was nice. I wish they had been a tad tighter in the waist.
Almost purchased these after trying them out!
Looks like subdued than it appears in the picture. Pretty loud print

LOVED these pants because of the corduroy material and fit. Usually straight ankle jeans tend to be more like skinny jeans on me but these were perfect. I read a review saying to size up because of the material (and I was forced to because they didn't have my size) but they fit well. Would definitely recommend since these can be dressed up or down!

It was one of the best nights of my entire life and it's all because of the conversation that was started because of these pants.

Overall though, I got a maternity vibe from this dress and felt a bit self conscious in it so wore it with a denim jacket and felt more comfortable in it. Wore it out to a casual dinner and got a ton of compliments!
